intro: Ardisia tacanensis, commonly known as the Tacana beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. Its fruit is a dark purple berry that ripens in the fall, attracting various bird species. Ardisia tacanensis is often found in shaded, moist forest understories where it thrives in partial to full shade.
